Crops: 1 Values for the N content of residues from IPCC (2019), Table 5.5B. The estimates are in units of g N (g residue)-1 on dry weight basis from a biomass-weighted average of aboveground and belowground for each crop based on data in IPCC (2019), Table 11.1a.

2 Values for the lignin content of residues from IPCC (2019), Table 5.5B. Winter wheat, spring wheat, barley, oats, millet, beans and pulses, soybeans, peanuts, values from Equi-Analytical Laboratories (2018); maize, rice, and sorghum from Cornell University (2017); and potatoes and tubers from Zereu et al. (2014).
4 Simple average of nitrogen content of aboveground and belowground.
5 Nitrogen content of aboveground assumed to represent all residue.
6 Value is an average of N fixing and non-N fixing grasses.
Notes: Uncertainty is assumed to be ±75% for the N content estimates and ±50% for the lignin content estimates, expressed as 95% confidence intervals.
